movies.title: French Cancan
movies.plot: Henri Danglard, proprietor of the fashionable (but bankrupt) cafe 'Le Paravent Chinois' featuring his mistress, belly dancer Lola, goes slumming in Montmarte (circa 1890) where the then-old-fashioned cancan is still danced. There, he conceives the idea of reviving the cancan as the feature of a new, more popular establishment...and meets Nini, a laundress and natural dancer, whom he hopes to star in his new show. But a tangled maze of jealousies intervenes...
movies.simplePlot: This comedy drama from Jean Renoir chronicles the revival of Paris' most notorious dance as it tells the story of a theater producer who turns a humble washerwoman into a star at the Moulin Rouge.

biography.bio: Jean-Alexis Moncorge started his career with 15 years at the theatre and debuted at the "Moulin Rouge" in Paris in 1929. Despite of his rude aspect he knew to be the gentleman of the French cinema in the time between the two World Wars. One of his most popular personalities was inspector Maigret. But he was also able to play all other kind of people: aristocrats, farmers, thieves and managers. He never stopped working and when death surprised him in 1976 he was still an institution for the French audience.
biography.name: Jean Gabin

biography.bio: Françoise Arnoul was born on June 3, 1931 in Constantine, France as Françoise Annette Gautsch. She is an actress, known for French Cancan (1955), The Sheep Has Five Legs (1954) and No Sun in Venice (1957). She was previously married to Georges Cravenne.
biography.name: Françoise Arnoul

biography.birthName: María de los Ángeles Félix Güereña
biography.bio: Doubtlessly the most famous Mexican movie star, María Félix created a larger-than-life character: herself. La Doña, as the star was known after the character of her 1943 movie Doña Bárbara, starred in 47 movies, most of them forgettable except for her presence in them. More a star than an actress, she constructed an image of a tough woman, a sort of one-liner she-male that went beyond the traditional role of Latin American women. Her marriage to Agustín Lara the most popular Latin composer from the 30s to the 60s, was a great event itself. Her fame went beyond Mexico to Latin America, Spain, France and Italy. She always refused to learn English, so she never acted in any English language movie. That's the main reason why her fame was related almost exclusively to Latin countries. After her last film, she was linked to a number of film projects, but never came back to the screen. Her last performance was on a Mexican historic soap opera, in 1970.
biography.name: María Félix

actors.character: Lola de Castro de la Fuente de Extremadura 'La Belle Abbesse'

biography.bio: Anna Amendola is an actress, known for French Cancan (1955), Avenida Roma, 66 (1958) and We, the Women (1953).
biography.name: Anna Amendola

biography.bio: Jean-Roger Caussimon was born on July 24, 1918 in Paris, France. He was an actor, known for Fantômas contre Scotland Yard (1967), French Cancan (1955) and Let Joy Reign Supreme (1975). He died on October 19, 1985 in Paris.
biography.name: Jean-Roger Caussimon

biography.bio: Dora Doll was born on May 19, 1922 in Berlin, Germany as Dorothea Hermina Feinberg. She was an actress, known for Touchez Pas au Grisbi (1954), Julia (1977) and The Young Lions (1958). She was married to François Deguelt and Raymond Pellegrin. She died on November 15, 2015 in Saint-Gilles, Gard, France.
biography.name: Dora Doll

biography.bio: Giani Esposito was born on August 22, 1930 in Etterbeek, Belgium. He was an actor, known for Paris Belongs to Us (1961), French Cancan (1955) and The Decameron (1971). He was married to Pascale Petit. He died on January 1, 1974 in Neuilly-sur-Seine, Hauts-de-Seine, France.
biography.name: Giani Esposito

biography.bio: Gaston Gabaroche was born on September 29, 1884 in Bordeaux, France as Charles Gaston Gabaroche. He was an actor, known for French Cancan (1955), Le Havre (2011) and La Vie de Bohème (1992). He died on August 28, 1961 in Marseille, France.
biography.name: Gaston Gabaroche

biography.bio: Jacques Jouanneau was born on October 3, 1926 in Angers, Maine-et-Loire, France. He was an actor, known for Asterix the Gaul (1967), Bed & Board (1970) and The Elusive Corporal (1962). He died on July 19, 2011 in Nîmes, Gard, France.
biography.name: Jacques Jouanneau

biography.bio: Jean Parédès was born on October 17, 1914 in Pusignan, Rhône, France as Victor Categnac. He was an actor, known for Quoi de neuf, Pussycat? (1965), Asterix and Cleopatra (1968) and Chouans! (1988). He died on July 13, 1998 in La Seyne-sur-Mer, Var, France.
biography.name: Jean Parédès

biography.bio: Franco Pastorino was born on December 25, 1933 in Milan, Lombardy, Italy. He was an actor, known for French Cancan (1955), Misère et noblesse (1954) and La fille du diable (1952). He died on July 13, 1959 in Milan.
biography.name: Franco Pastorino

biography.bio: Michèle Philippe was born on January 17, 1926 in Paris, France. She was an actress, known for French Cancan (1955), Le coeur sur la main (1948) and His Father's Portrait (1953). She died on September 23, 1972 in Paris.
biography.name: Michèle Philippe

biography.bio: Born in a musician's family, he spent the first fifteen years of his career appearing both on stage and on screen, mostly in supporting roles. His breakthrough came after Jean-Luc Godard's Contempt (1963) and about 100 films, ranging from art-house movies to commercial mainstream, followed. He won the Best Actor Award at the Cannes Film Festival for A Leap in the Dark (1980) in 1980 and the Silver Bear in Berlin for Une étrange affaire (1981) in 1982. Not surprisingly, he was chosen to impersonate Mr. Cinema in Agnès Varda One Hundred and One Nights (1995).
biography.name: Michel Piccoli

biography.bio: Albert Rémy was born on April 9, 1915 in Sèvres, Hauts-de-Seine, France. He was an actor and director, known for The 400 Blows (1959), Le train (1964) and Shoot the Piano Player (1960). He died on January 26, 1967 in Paris, France.
biography.name: Albert Rémy

biography.bio: France Roche was born on April 2, 1921 in Saint-Tropez, Var, France. She was an actress and writer, known for Girl in His Pocket (1957), Cinépanorama (1956) and Une histoire de chiens (1961). She was married to Gilbert de Goldschmidt and François Chalais. She died on December 14, 2013 in Paris, France.
biography.name: France Roche
